chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)
Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Adam Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary, and Parenting Classes.Maintain absolute sobriety.

Order to release bond
Order to Release Bond

2:35 PM Defendant Joshua Adam Weiss appeared by video, in custody at Walworth County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Joshua Adam Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads  no contest to counts one and two and guilty to count three.  Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders sentence withheld; three years probation with conditions, Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary, parenting classes, Maintain absolute sobriety. Court costs due December 30 2022. Felony rights given to defendant.  Counts four and five are dismissed and read in. 22 Days Credit.
Return on warrant on October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Adam Weiss appeared by video, in custody from the Walworth County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Joshua Adam Weiss. Warrant to remain until Defendant is back in Rock County. State argues for bond modification, Court denies.

03:29 PM Defendant Joshua Adam Weiss in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Mason C Braunschweig and Margarett Ginocchio  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $2500 set with conditions of Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No contact directly or indirectly with victims ALG, JAW or DOB, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere unless authorized by CPS if they are involved. No contact directly or indirectly with victim R.W. his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except by text messages regarding placement of children. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess paraphernalia.
